title: Identity
text: Given $$sin^2\left(t\right)+cos^2\left(t\right)=1$$, we want to show the other $$2$$ Pythagorean Identities: $$1+{\operatorname{cot}\left(t\right)}^2={\operatorname{csc}\left(t\right)}^2$$ and $$1+tan^2\left(\theta\right)={\operatorname{sec}\left(\theta\right)}^2$$

title: Simplify
text: $$\frac{sin^2\left(t\right)+cos^2\left(t\right)}{{ssin^2eft(t\right)}=\frac{1}{sin^2\left(t\right)}$$ becomes $$1+{\operatorname{cot}\left(t\right)}^2={\operatorname{csc}\left(t\right)}^2$$, giving us one of the Pythagoran Identities

title: Simplify
text: $$\frac{sin^2\left(t\right)+cos^2\left(t\right)}{{ccos^2eft(t\right)}=\frac{1}{cos^2\left(t\right)}$$ becomes $$tan^2\left(t\right)+1{\operatorname{sec}\left(t\right)}^2$$, giving us the last Pythagoran Identity.
